item.title: 英国海军向霍尔木兹海峡附近船只发出罕见警告
item.description: 英国海军罕见地向海员发出警告，中东地区的紧张局势加剧可能会影响航运，包括通过霍尔木兹海峡的航运。【原文：The UK Navy issued a rare warning to mariners that higher tensions in the Middle East could impact shipping, including through the Strait of Hormuz.】

item.title: 西班牙电网否认停电前电压处理不当的报道
item.description: 西班牙电网运营商 Red Electrica 否认在 4 月 28 日全国大停电前几分钟采取了任何异常行动。【原文：Spanish grid operator Red Electrica denies it took any action that was out of the ordinary in the minutes before a blackout hit the country on April 28.】

item.title: DeepSeek 取得突破后，阿里巴巴员工假期都在工作
item.description: 今年 1 月，DeepSeek 以其低成本、功能强大的人工智能模型震惊了全球科技行业，阿里巴巴集团控股有限公司的工程师们取消休假，在春节假期期间加班加点，奋起直追。【原文：Alibaba Group Holding Ltd.’s engineers canceled vacations and worked through the Chinese New Year holiday to play catch up after DeepSeek shocked the global tech industry with its low-cost, powerful artificial-intelligence model in January.】

item.title: 法国电力公司（EDF）发现反应堆管道有新裂缝的迹象，法国核电困境是否会卷土重来？
item.description: 法国电力公司（Electricite de France SA）发现有迹象表明，一座不到三年前修好的核反应堆的管道可能又出现了 "应力腐蚀 "裂缝，这再次引发了人们对该国电力供应可靠性的担忧。【原文：Electricite de France SA has found indications that “stress corrosion” cracks may have returned to pipes at a nuclear reactor fixed less than three years ago, renewing fears about the reliability of the country’s power supply.】

item.title: 贝森特预测美国今年预算赤字将接近 7
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）指责民主党人，他预测今年将再次出现异常庞大的预算赤字。【原文：US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent blamed Democrats for what he predicted will be another unusually large budget deficit this year.】

item.title: 支付公司 Stripe 将收购加密钱包提供商 Privy
item.description: Stripe 公司同意收购加密货币钱包提供商 Privy，这是在该支付公司最近收购稳定币基础设施公司 Bridge 的基础上进行的。【原文：Stripe Inc. agreed to acquire crypto wallet provider Privy, building on the payment company’s recent acquisition of stablecoin infrastructure firm Bridge.】

item.title: Uber 在佛罗里达州涉嫌保险欺诈，展开法律攻势
item.description: 优步科技公司（Uber Technologies Inc. 在佛罗里达州起诉了一群律师、医疗服务提供商和共享汽车司机，称他们伪造车祸、制造损害和接受不必要的医疗程序，以利用保险政策，这让这家共享汽车巨头损失了 "数百万美元 "的法律费用。【原文：Uber Technologies Inc. sued a group of lawyers, medical providers and rideshare drivers it claims staged car accidents, manufactured damages and received unnecessary medical procedures to take advantage of insurance policies in Florida, costing the rideshare giant “several million dollars” in legal fees.】

item.title: 以下是英国支出大调整的赢家和输家
item.description: 英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）阐述了她将如何在各部门之间分配超过6000亿英镑（8100亿美元）的年度支出，为工党执政的第一年画上了句号。这些决定将对英国产生广泛影响，因为英国的支出约占经济总量的五分之一。【原文：Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves laid out how she’ll divide more than £600 billion ($810 billion) of annual spending between departments, capping Labour’s first year in power. The decisions will have a broad impact across the UK, where the outlays account for about a fifth of the economy.】

item.title: 迪士尼、康卡斯特起诉人工智能图像生成器中途夭折
item.description: 迪斯尼公司和康卡斯特公司联手起诉 Midjourney 公司，指控这家初创公司侵犯版权，这是大型媒体公司与新兴人工智能企业之间关系紧张的最新迹象。【原文：Walt Disney Co. and Comcast Corp. teamed up to sue Midjourney Inc., accusing the startup of copyright infringement in the latest sign of tension between major media companies and a new crop of artificial intelligence businesses.】

item.title: 税收争论结束后，南非预算批准指日可待
item.description: 南非国民议会批准了财政部的财政框架，在经过数月的增税争论之后，年度预算的通过又近了一步。【原文：South Africa’s National Assembly approved the Treasury’s fiscal framework, bringing the adoption of the annual budget a step closer after months of wrangling over tax increases.】

item.title: 来自洛杉矶彭博全球信贷论坛的最新消息
item.description: 洛杉矶市中心天际线。摄影师：Kyle Grillot/Bloomberg【原文：Downtown Los Angeles skyline. Photographer: Kyle Grillot/Bloomberg】

item.title: 贝森特称赞特朗普政策使 CPI 有了 "实质性 "改善
item.description: 财政部长斯科特-贝森特将美国通胀放缓归功于唐纳德-特朗普总统的政策，并表示他在贸易问题上挑战了 "数十年的现状"。【原文：Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent credited President Donald Trump’s policies for a slowdown in US inflation, and said he had challenged a “decades-old status quo” on trade.】

item.title: 保罗-都铎-琼斯称特朗普将挑选 "鸽派 "美联储主席
item.description: 亿万富翁投资者保罗-都铎-琼斯（Paul Tudor Jones）表示，唐纳德-特朗普总统很可能任命一位 "极端鸽派 "的美联储主席，以适应他的增长议程。【原文：Billionaire investor Paul Tudor Jones said President Donald Trump is likely to appoint an “uber dovish” Federal Reserve chair to accommodate his growth agenda, adding he thinks US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent would be his likely pick when Jerome Powell’s term ends.】

item.title: 交易员权衡中美贸易进展，美国股市摇摆不定
item.description: 周三，美国股市在小幅上涨和下跌之间摇摆不定，交易员们对消费者物价降温的乐观报告保持观望，并对全球贸易前景进行评估。【原文：US stocks oscillated between small gains and losses on Wednesday, as traders look past an upbeat report on cooling consumer prices and assess the outlook for global trade.】

item.title: 以下是美国 5 月份 CPI 报告的主要内容
item.description: 以下是周三公布的美国 5 月份消费者价格指数报告的主要内容：【原文：Here are the key takeaways from today’s May US consumer price index report, released Wednesday:】

item.title: 需求疲软导致鸡蛋价格下跌 11%至 12 月以来最低点
item.description: 禽流感疫情爆发后，鸡蛋价格飙升至创纪录水平，但由于需求不旺，上个月消费者为鸡蛋支付的价格是 12 月份以来最低的，比上月下降了 11%。【原文：Consumers last month paid the least for eggs since December, dropping 11% from the prior month, on lackluster demand after bird flu outbreaks sent prices surging to records.】

item.title: 财政部长贝森特在众议院小组作证
item.description: 5 月 6 日，财政部长斯科特-贝森特在华盛顿众议院拨款小组委员会听证会上。摄影师：Tierney L. Cross/BloombergTierney L. Cross/Bloomberg【原文：Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent during a House Appropriations Subcommittee hearing in Washington on May 6. Photographer: Tierney L. Cross/Bloomberg】

item.title: 绿色公司首席执行官称空调驱动新印度电力需求
item.description: 印度新增电力需求的最大来源是空调，超过了运输和数据中心。【原文：The biggest source of new electricity demand in India is coming from air conditioning, outpacing transport and data centers.】

item.title: DoorDash 将收购 Symbiosys 以提升其年收入 10 亿美元的广告部门
item.description: DoorDash 公司以 1.75 亿美元的价格收购了广告技术公司 Symbiosys，为其最近的收购狂潮再添一笔，从而巩固了目前年收入超过 10 亿美元的广告业务。【原文：DoorDash Inc. is adding to its recent buying spree by acquiring advertising tech firm Symbiosys for $175 million, bolstering an ad business that now generates more than $1 billion annually.】

item.title: 奥特曼支持的机器人送货初创公司融资 8000 万美元
item.description: Coco Robotics 是一家经营冷藏箱大小的轮式送货机器人车队的初创公司，该公司已从 OpenAI 首席执行官山姆-奥特曼（Sam Altman）和其他支持者那里筹集到 8000 万美元资金，这表明自动送货技术正在不断进步。Coco Robotics 计划于周三宣布这笔融资，由风险投资公司 SNR 领投，Pelion Venture Partners、Offline Ventures 和 Altman 的兄弟之一 Max 等投资者也参与了投资。有了新的资金，Coco Robot【原文：Coco Robotics, a startup that operates a fleet of cooler-sized delivery robots on wheels, has raised $80 million in funding from OpenAI Chief Executive Officer Sam Altman and other backers, a sign that automated delivery technology is advancing. The financing, which Coco Robotics plans to announce Wednesday, was led by venture capital firm SNR, with participation from investors including Pelion Venture Partners, Offline Ventures and one of Altman’s brothers, Max. With the new funding, Coco Robot】

item.title: 英国里夫斯承诺出资 390 亿英镑建造更多经济适用房
item.description: 英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）在英国支出审查中承诺为经济适用房建设提供 390 亿英镑（约合 526 亿美元）的资金，因为政府正努力重振其建设 150 万套住房的势头。【原文：Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves committed £39 billion ($52.6 billion) to affordable housebuilding in the UK spending review, as the government seeks to regain momentum in its bid to build 1.5 million homes.】

item.title: 通胀疲软助推美联储降息押注，国债反弹
item.description: 美国国债大涨，原因是美国消费通胀放缓促使交易商加大了对美联储今年不止一次降息的押注。【原文：US Treasuries surged as easing US consumer inflation prompted traders to increase their wagers on more than one Federal Reserve interest-rate cut this year.】

item.title: 非洲科技独角兽支持者关注医疗保健领域的人工智能交易
item.description: Chronos Capital 是新兴市场独角兽公司 Tyme Group 和 Optasia 的早期支持者，它正寻求投资在医疗保健领域部署人工智能的公司，因为它希望利用这项有望改变医疗行业的技术。【原文：Chronos Capital, an early backer of emerging market unicorns Tyme Group and Optasia, is looking to invest in companies deploying artificial intelligence in healthcare as it seeks to capitalize on a technology that’s expected to transform the medical industry.】

item.title: 美国核心通胀率连续第四个月升幅低于预期
item.description: 美国 5 月份基本通胀率的增幅连续第四个月低于预期，这表明企业正在想方设法限制将关税带来的成本上升转嫁给客户的幅度。【原文：Underlying US inflation rose in May by less than forecast for the fourth month in a row, suggesting companies are finding ways to limit how much of higher costs from tariffs they pass through to customers.】

item.title: 特朗普称中国协议 "已达成"，但须经领导人批准
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示，与中国的贸易框架已经完成，其中包括北京 "提前 "供应稀土以及中国学生进入美国大学的协议。【原文：US President Donald Trump said a trade framework with China was completed that included an agreement for Beijing to supply rare earths “UP FRONT” as well as access for Chinese students at American universities.】

item.title: 黄金超越欧元成为第二储备资产，央行纷纷买入
item.description: 创纪录的高购买量和价格的迅猛上涨使黄金超越欧元，成为全球央行储备中的第二大资产。【原文：Record-high purchases and a blistering rally in prices has seen gold overtake the euro as the second-largest asset in the reserves of the world’s central banks.】

item.title: 里夫斯誓言在支出审查中实现英国全国范围的 "复兴
item.description: 英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）在概述三年内全国公路、铁路、房屋和能源项目建设支出计划时，誓言要更新英国的基础设施和公共服务。【原文：Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves vowed to renew Britain’s infrastructure and public services as she outlined three years of spending plans to build roads, railways, houses and energy projects nationwide.】

item.title: 痴迷美元的阿根廷人重新爱上了购买黄金
item.description: 黄金正在赢得阿根廷人的心，这个国家曾经几乎毫无理性地迷恋美元。【原文：Gold is winning over the hearts of Argentines, a nation once almost irrationally devoted to the dollar.】

item.title: Cipriani 寄望私人信贷推动豪华度假村发展
item.description: 在威尼斯开设 Harry's 酒吧将近一个世纪后，Cipriani 正在为下一个篇章下大赌注：向私人信贷机构申请 1.9 亿美元贷款，为全球发展提供资金。【原文：Nearly a century after opening Harry’s Bar in Venice, Cipriani is betting big on its next chapter: turning to private credit for a $190 million loan to fund global growth.】
